title: City of Berkeley MEHKO
description: Operate a Microenterprise Home Kitchen in Berkeley. Limits: up to 30 meals/day OR 90 meals/week, ≤$100,000 gross/year. Annual MEHKO permit fee varies (contact EHD for current fee).

steps.title: Plan Your MEHKO
steps.content:
**What to do:** Review Berkeley's MEHKO rules and basic limits.

**Why it matters:** Knowing the limits prevents delays and denials.

**What you need:**
- ☐ Understand meal and revenue caps (30/day OR 90/week, ≤$100,000/year)
- ☐ Draft menu and service model
- ☐ Kitchen setup that meets safety basics

**Where/how:** Visit Berkeley's Food Safety & Inspection page and the BMC MHKO section.

**Cost & time:** $0 · 15–30 minutes

**Ready when:** You understand limits and feasibility for your home.

steps.title: Approvals & Training
steps.content:
**What to do:** Obtain CFPM certification and any property/business approvals.

**Why it matters:** Required before your permit can be issued.

**What you need:**
- ☐ CFPM (ANSI-CFP) certificate
- ☐ Food Handler cards for any helpers
- ☐ Landlord/HOA OK if applicable
- ☐ City business license if required

**Where/how:** Take an ANSI-approved CFPM course; check City business licensing.

**Cost & time:** ~$60–$200 · 1–2 days total

**Ready when:** You have a CFPM certificate and any needed approvals.

steps.title: Prepare Required Documents
steps.content:
**What to do:** Gather the documents you'll submit with your application.

**Why it matters:** Incomplete submissions delay approval and inspection.

**What you need:**
- ☐ SOP form — go to Step 4: Standard Operating Procedures (SOP)
- ☐ Health Permit Application — go to Step 5: Health Permit Application
- ☐ CFPM certificate (from Step 2: Approvals & Training)
- ☐ Government ID and basic business info

**Where/how:** Organize files (PDFs/photos) for upload or printing.

**Cost & time:** $0 · 30–60 minutes

**Ready when:** All documents are filled/signed and stored as PDFs.

steps.title: Standard Operating Procedures (SOP)
steps.content:
**What to do:** Complete the MEHKO SOP covering menu, prep, cooling/holding, cleaning, and sanitation.

**Why it matters:** Shows how you will keep food safe at home.

**What you need:**
- ☐ Menu and ingredients list
- ☐ Prep/cooking/cooling/holding details
- ☐ Cleaning/sanitizing plan; handwashing setup

**Where/how:** Contact Berkeley Environmental Health at (510) 981-5310 to request the SOP form.

**Cost & time:** $0 · 30–60 minutes

**Ready when:** SOP is complete and consistent with your operation.
searchTerms: City of Berkeley home kitchen SOP

steps.title: Health Permit Application
steps.content:
**What to do:** Complete the City of Berkeley MEHKO Health Permit Application.

**Why it matters:** This is the formal request to operate.

**What you need:**
- ☐ Owner contact and site address
- ☐ CFPM certificate details
- ☐ SOP — go to Step 4: Standard Operating Procedures (SOP)

**Where/how:** Contact Berkeley Environmental Health at (510) 981-5310 to request the application form.

**Cost & time:** $0 to fill · 15–30 minutes

**Ready when:** Application is complete and matches your SOP.

steps.title: Submit Application & Fees
steps.content:
**What to do:** Submit the completed forms and pay required fees.

**Why it matters:** The city processes your permit after complete submission and payment.

**What you need:**
- ☐ Completed Application — go to Step 5: Health Permit Application
- ☐ Completed SOP — go to Step 4: Standard Operating Procedures (SOP)
- ☐ CFPM certificate
- ☐ Payment method for fees

**Where/how:** Submit to Berkeley Environmental Health; contact (510) 981-5310 for submission methods.

**Cost & time:** Contact EHD for current fee · 10–20 minutes

**Ready when:** City confirms receipt and payment.

steps.title: Schedule & Pass Inspection
steps.content:
**What to do:** Coordinate a home kitchen inspection with Berkeley Environmental Health.

**Why it matters:** Passing inspection is required before operating.

**What you need:**
- ☐ Kitchen ready per your SOP
- ☐ Thermometer, sanitizer, handwash setup
- ☐ All required equipment functional

**Where/how:** The department will provide scheduling details after application approval.

**Cost & time:** Included in application fee · 1–2 hours on site

**Ready when:** You receive a pass and any corrections are resolved.

steps.title: Receive Permit
steps.content:
**What to do:** Get your MEHKO permit after passing inspection and keep it on hand.

**Why it matters:** You must have a valid permit to operate.

**What you need:**
- ☐ Final approval notice
- ☐ Permit document

**Where/how:** Issued by Berkeley Environmental Health after inspection approval.

**Cost & time:** $0 (after application fee) · timeline varies by case

**Ready when:** You have the permit and any conditions noted by the inspector.

steps.title: Operate & Stay Compliant
steps.content:
**What to do:** Follow your SOP and MEHKO limits; renew as required.

**Why it matters:** Staying within rules protects customers and your permit status.

**What you need:**
- ☐ Daily/weekly meal logs under limits
- ☐ Temperature & cleaning records
- ☐ Permit renewal reminder

**Where/how:** Keep simple records; contact the department if your menu or volume changes.

**Cost & time:** Renewal fees apply · ongoing

**Ready when:** You track meals, keep records, and schedule renewal on time.

steps.title: Contact Info
steps.content:
**What to do:** Use the contact information below for questions and assistance.

**Why it matters:** City staff can help with specific questions about your application.

**What you need:**
- ☐ Phone number for questions
- ☐ Office hours and location
- ☐ Website for additional resources

**Where/how:** Contact Berkeley Environmental Health using the information below.

**Cost & time:** $0 · varies by question complexity

**Ready when:** You have the information you need to proceed.

**Contact Information:**
- **Phone:** (510) 981-5310
- **Department:** City of Berkeley Environmental Health Division
- **Website:** City of Berkeley Food Safety Program page
